article.simpara: This document describes the tailored Cleanroom process to be used in the development of the Co-Dfns compiler. The process described here is driven primarily by a need to adapt the Cleanroom Process to the use of a single member team with only minimal support from a few other assets. This requires that a number of processes are scaled down and that certain other measures are in place to assure a high degree of performance.
Normally this document would also include specific details about environment and tools in use, but this is not necessary for the team size.

The descriptions, enumerations, and organization of these processes is taken directly from The Cleanroom Reference Model as found in Cleanroom Software Engineering by Prowell, et al. but have been adapted to fit this project. For definitions of work products and the entry exit expectations of processes, as well as other normal operating procedures, the above references constitute the norm. On occassion, some work products may not contain all standard content, as this content is not relevant to this project. Most, if not all, of these omissions are on the basis of minimal management processes, accounting for a single developer environment.
